page.title: 13ST MARGARET'S POPULATION
page.content: A population survey of the upper village showed that as much as a third of the population might be retired. This is more than twice the proportion in the other villages surveyed. The village provides employment in tourism and service industries but most of the workers travel elsewhere. Almost 60% of the total workforce is employed in Dover. Most of the junior children are at the village school but those over 11 have to go elsewhere. The grammar school children go mainly to Dover, some girls travel to Folkestone. Other secondary pupils go to Dover,Whitfield and Walmer. The residents like their village,many would leave it unchanged. Some want improved lighting,others further traffic restrictions. A major concern among old people is vandalism and hooliganism. They would like to see more policemen in the village.
